Pre-Game Insights: South Africa have never lost to Bangladesh in T20Is.
South Africa are familiar with the New York venue, having played both their games here.
Bangladesh's top-order batting remains suspect, as it was the department that failed in their win over Sri Lanka.
South Africa's bowlers have been in great form, with Anrich Nortje and Ottneil Baartman leading the charge.
Bangladesh's quicks were impressive against Sri Lanka, with Taskin Ahmed and Mustafizur Rahman performing well.
Towhid Hridoy is quickly enhancing his reputation as a big hitter, having struck 42 sixes in his 15 months of international cricket.
Anrich Nortje is working his way back into rhythm after a long injury layoff.
Bangladesh are waiting on news of Shoriful Islam's fitness.

South Africa's probable XI includes Quinton de Kock (wk), Reeza Hendricks, Aiden Markram (capt), Tristan Stubbs, Heinrich Klaasen, David Miller, Marco Jansen, Keshav Maharaj, Kagiso Rabada, Ottneil Baartman, and Anrich Nortje.
South Africa captain Aiden Markram is not taking Bangladesh easily.
Bangladesh head coach Chandika Hathurusinghe acknowledges the challenge posed by South Africa but expresses confidence in his team's ability to compete on this surface.
